House, 1968), 456. Nietzsche goes on to argue that (slave) moral-
ity is the danger of dangers, so the reader is supposed to answer the rhetorical questions at the
end of the passage in the affirmative.
4 For an entertaining and instructive account of this case, see James Randi, The Magic of Uri
Geller(New York: Ballantine Books, 1975).
5 Both quotations are from Christopher Cerf and Victor Navasky, The Experts Speak(New York:
